Text: Well I think a lot of it goes back to the establishment of citizens united because it said that corporations are like individuals and they can give like individuals and they can give millions and millions of dollars. And I don't imagine there's anybody in this group that could match that
All Arguments Summarized:
1. The establishment of Citizens United is significant.
2. Citizens United decided that corporations have the same rights as individuals.
3. Corporations can give large sums of money to political campaigns, similar to individual contributions.
4. No individual is likely able to contribute amounts comparable to corporations.
AGAINST: limitCampaignContributions: No individual is likely able to contribute amounts comparable to corporations
other: Citizens United decided that corporations have the same rights as individuals
notRelevant: The establishment of Citizens United is significant  Corporations can give large sums of money to political campaigns, similar to individual contributions

Text: I also think it should definitely be a national holiday because everyone brought up a good point if you're working and you have really long job hours and you can't make it in. 1. The speaker believes that voting should be a national holiday.
2. The speaker thinks that this would be beneficial because some people have long working hours and may not be able to make it to vote.
3. The speaker suggests that if voting were a paid holiday, people would not have to choose between voting and losing their paycheck.
